remarks: Value of a splice, assuming the input word ` S ` has already been decomposed into its pieces.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Oct-2015.)
statement:
splval2.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. Word X ) $.
splval2.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. Word X ) $.
splval2.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Word X ) $.
splval2.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. Word X ) $.
splval2.s $e |- ( ph -> S = ( ( A ++ B ) ++ C ) ) $.
splval2.f $e |- ( ph -> F = ( # ` A ) ) $.
splval2.t $e |- ( ph -> T = ( F + ( # ` B ) ) ) $.
splval2 $p |- ( ph -> ( S splice <. F , T , R >. ) = ( ( A ++ R ) ++ C ) ) $.
